intro: Henckelia craspedodroma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes bellflowers, and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are often violet or blue in color. Henckelia craspedodroma is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
